results.title: Training to win
results.creator_credit: John Hallowell and National Football League of Australia
results.brief_description:
Demonstrates some of the lesser known drills used by Tom Hafey, David Parkin and Ron Barassi, and features Collingwood, Hawthorn and North Melbourne players in training sequences. Excellent for showing the variety that can be introduced into seminar training.
Football sequences courtesy of Channel 7.

results.title: Training methods: training program
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “National Coaching Development Programme Level One”
Encourages coaches and potential sports coaches to consider: training for energy production; learning pace; strength development; flexibility improvement; monitoring of training; strategy; diet; skill development. Examples are given across many sports.

results.title: Training men for the atomic age
results.creator_credit: Hearst Metrotone and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Atoms for Peace”
The training program in nuclear physics for foreign scientists sponsored by the US Atomic Energy Commission. Shows activities at the University of Pennsylvania, Oak Ridge Institute of Nuclear Studies, International School of Nuclear Science and Engineering at La Grange, Illinois, and construction of a nuclear reactor at Shippingport, Pennsylvania.

results.title: Training mannikin
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”
Intended mainly for first aid instructors but also of interest to first aid classes, the various ways in which a manikin may be used to train a class to perform both exhaled air resuscitation and closed chest cardiac massage are demonstrated by an instructor and his pupils. Care and maintenance of the manikin is illustrated as well as the hygienic precautions taken to safeguard users.

results.title: Training for development
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the practical assistance given to several students from developing countries by the Australian Development Assistance Bureau. The students are given short practical courses designed to meet the needs of the government.

results.title: Training dogs: the Woodhouse way
results.brief_description: Dogs can be a problem. Whether puppies or fully grown, they can give owners a lot of trouble if they are not properly trained. How do you cope with a young puppy and prevent puddles in the hall? How do you deal with an adult dog pulling on the lead, jumping at people or terrified of traffic? Barbara Woodhouse’s tackles fundamental problems of obedience facing new dog owners and provides strategies to overcome them. Mrs Woodhouse takes untrained dogs of different breeds and shows how dog and owner can quickly become a happy team.

results.title: Training day [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Antoine Fuqua, Bobby Newmyer, Jeffrey Silver, NPV Entertainment, Warner Bros Pictures and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: It takes weeks to prove yourself when starting a new job. Unfortunately, rookie policeman Jake Hoyt has one day to prove himself to Detective Sergeant Alonzo Harris, head of the L.A. Police Department narcotic squad. Harris has a reputation for being the best, and Hoyt is eager to impress him on the ride-along. However, Hoyt soon discovers that Detective Sergeant Harris makes his own rules, becoming violent when his street-justice methods are questioned. Battling with his own morals, Hoyt soon realises that there is more to Harris than meets the eye, and soon realises that his first day at work may also be his last. Denzel Washington won the Best Actor in a Leading Role Academy Award in 2002 for his role as the corrupt Detective Sergeant Alonzo Harris, while Ethan Hawke (Jake Hoyt) was nominated for the Best Actor in a Supporting Role. Cast also includes Tom Berenger, Scott Glenn and musicians Snoop Dogg, Dr. Dre and Macy Gray.
